message.body: Hello! How are you
Hey there!
How are you
Super busy, still working. U?
Oh I see. How is work?
Big deadline on Wednesday; end of 8 month long project with TONS to do
Oh nice. Well good luck on the large amount of work!!!
Thanks!! I love it (still working, lol).
How are u? It's late on east coast, where r u?
Ah I see. Its awesome that you love what you do. :) Don't get to hear that too often these days
I am well. Just got home from a family dinner. I'm in TN lol
How is life on the east coast? I haven't visited that area before
:-) took a leap of faith (and a few months of unpaid bills...along with a HUGE student loan debt) to pursue a job I love. But still new to recent shifts,so still giddy!
Love dinners with my family (parents and siblings more so than extended family). You?
East coast is where I've always lived, but one of my intentions by shifting to self-employment is to afford more time/$ to move/explore/travel
Wow I wish I knew more people with that amount of dedication. Very inspiring! :) I'm still not sure what my dream job is. Lol
I grew up in a very large asian family so i like the atmosphere. But I also enjoy spending quality time with my parents and brother since we are busy allthe time.

Thanks :-) Honestly, it has evolved over the years and in hindsight, I wish that I were more curious and exploratory about careers in college. I was so rigidly "married" to the career title and what was required to do it (clinical psychologist); could have saved myself time and $ if I had been more flexible. So... Enjoy the adventure of exploring what you might do for a career (so cliche, but enjoy the "journey")
Ah I see. My parents seem to enjoy self employment over the years. It does have many benefits but a lot of hard work. Where do you plan to travel once you have time?

EVERYWHERE, lol!! From doing a cross-country camper trip with my husband and son to a three-week backpack tour of Europe (my sister, mom, and me - planning and just started making payments for trip in 2015).
I want to explore so many other places too
Have u travelled!
Ill do my best to keep your advise in mind during my college life:) thank you so much for your words!
Happy to share :-)
Oh wow that sounds like an amazing time! I've never really thought about a cross country camping trip before. Must be a unique experience. And backpacking sounds like so much fun with family.

I haven't done much traveling since I began college but I've been back and forth between Vietnam and California since I was very young. My parents required me to learn traditions and skills needed for when I am married. Other than that I didn't do much traveling so far. I'm hoping to qualify for teachingEnglish in either Korea or Japan in 2015 though.

Wow! What was/is that like?? I value my family's traditions strongly, but they are consistent with American traditions. What have u noticed? Do u noticea "shift/transition" from American to Vietnamese (right?) traditions? So curious, please feel free to go to bed too, lol. I could ask questions all night

I'm sorry I fell asleep without saying anything. Haha. There are a lot of differences between the cultures. For example: we pay close attention to out family linage. Power within the family is usually seen there. We have to be very careful when addressing people in and out of the family. some people getvery angry if the basic traditions aren't followed correctly. It's been a bit difficult to learn everything while growing up in America but its pretty interesting to see the differences
